name: DE-CIX Chicago Route Servers
notes:
# DE-CIX Chicago Route Servers

Number of prefixes are suggested maxpref values!

---

## Route Server Address Information

**rs1.ord.de-cix.net**

* 149.112.11.252
* 2001:504:102::f528:a:1

**rs2.ord.de-cix.net**

* 149.112.11.253
* 2001:504:102::f528:a:2

---

## Route Server Control

You may use BGP Standard/Extended/Large Communities to control route advertisement via the route servers:

* **(62760:62760), (62760:1:0):** Redistribute to all route server peers (default)

* **(62760:$PEER-AS), (rt:62760:$PEER-AS), (62760:1:62760):** Redistribute to $PEER-AS

* **(0:$PEER-AS), (rt:0:$PEER-AS), (62760:0:$PEER-AS):** Do not redistribute to $PEER-AS

* **(0:62760), (62760:0:0):** Do not redistribute

If $PEER-AS uses a 16b ASN, you may use Standard, Extended or Large Communities

If $PEER-AS uses a 32b ASN, you have to use Extended or Large Communities

There are additional communities for controlling announcements:

* **65535:0**           GRACEFUL_SHUTDOWN
* **65535:666**       BLACKHOLE
* **62760:65281**   NO-EXPORT
* **62760:65282**   NO-ADVERTISE

---

## Additional Information

For more information on route server control, please see:

[DE-CIX Chicago Route Server Guide](https://www.de-cix.net/en/locations/united-states/chicago/routeserver-guide)

[DE-CIX Blackholing Guide](https://www.de-cix.net/en/resources/de-cix-blackholing-guide)

[DE-CIX Route Server Informational BGP Communities](https://www.de-cix.net/en/resources/route-server-guides/informational-bgp-communities)

[DE-CIX Route Server Operational BGP Communities](https://www.de-cix.net/en/resources/route-server-guides/operational-bgp-communities)
